scenes.background: You are leading a project team that has just received an urgent assignment requiring a significant amount of work to be completed within a tight deadline. The team is feeling a lot of pressure, and morale is low, with some members showing signs of frustration and anxiety. One of your team members, Lisa, says: 'I don't think we can meet this deadline. It's just too much work in too little time.' You responded: 'Lisa, I know it's challenging, but we can do it if we support each other and stay focused.' Now, [Monica] and [Bob] are also expressing their concerns. [Monica] looks worried and says, 'I'm afraid we're setting ourselves up for failure.' [Bob] frowns and adds, 'I agree with Monica. This is unrealistic.' You acknowledged their concerns and suggested focusing on the most critical tasks first. [Monica] sighs deeply and says, 'Even if we focus on critical tasks, this is still overwhelming.' [Bob], crossing his arms, adds, 'Yeah, we need a more practical approach.' You tried to motivate the team by highlighting that challenging situations help in growth. [Monica] looks skeptical and says, 'But what if we fail despite our efforts?' [Bob] nods and says, 'Exactly, we need a plan B.' You agreed it was wise to have a backup plan and suggested outlining one quickly. [Monica] looks somewhat relieved and says, 'Okay, but who will take charge of the backup plan?' [Bob] adds, 'And how soon can we have it ready?'
scenes.description: [Monica] and [Bob] inquire about the details of the backup plan.

options.text: Let's designate someone to lead the backup plan and set a quick deadline for it.
options.analysis: You acknowledged the need for leadership and a timeline for the backup plan, showing good emotional detection and interpersonal balance skills.

options.text: I think it's best if we all contribute to the backup plan and aim to have it ready by the end of the day.
options.analysis: You emphasized teamwork and set a clear deadline, demonstrating good emotional control and communication skills, but emotional detection could be slightly improved.

options.text: Let's not get ahead of ourselves. We need to focus on completing the main tasks first.
options.analysis: You acknowledged the difficulty but emphasized focus on the main tasks, showing a good balance of emotional detection and social skills, though emotional regulation could be enhanced.
